title: Restart success image asset loading and ensure reliable rendering with URL-encoded filename

requirements.summary: Update the success image src to use a URL-encoded path while keeping the exact case-sensitive filename "Kanni 14.PNG".
acceptanceCriteria: After clicking “Yes”, the success screen requests the image via a URL-encoded path (space encoded as %20) while still referencing the exact filename "Kanni 14.PNG" (case-sensitive).
In Chrome and Safari (desktop and mobile), the image renders on the success screen without requiring any manual refresh.

file_operations.description: Change the success/result source to build the path from the exact filename "Kanni 14.PNG" and URL-encode it (so the rendered request uses %20 for spaces). Ensure the rendered success flow only uses the encoded URL derived from that exact case-sensitive filename.
Add a static preload hint for the success image using the URL-encoded path to improve first-render reliability in browsers with stricter caching/loading behavior (Chrome/Safari).

requirements.summary: Add runtime error handling for the success image with an English fallback message that preserves layout.
acceptanceCriteria: If the image fails to load (e.g., 404), the user sees an English message indicating the image could not be loaded (without breaking the page layout).
If the image loads successfully, no fallback message is shown.

file_operations.description: Introduce success-image load state handling using onError/onLoad. If loading fails, keep the success layout intact and show a clear English fallback message in place of (or alongside) the image container; if loading succeeds, render no fallback message.

requirements.summary: Ensure the deployable public assets contain the exact success image file and remove/avoid references to similarly-named variants.
acceptanceCriteria: The repository contains the file at "frontend/public/assets/generated/Kanni 14.PNG" exactly (including capitalization and spacing).
The success/result view references only "/assets/generated/Kanni 14.PNG" (URL-encoded as needed) and does not reference any other success image filenames anywhere in the rendered success flow.

file_operations.description: Add the success image to the deployable public directory at the exact required path and filename (capital K, space, .PNG extension): frontend/public/assets/generated/Kanni 14.PNG.
